title: Unable to build python3.6.x on MacOSx
body:
Summary

### Expected Result

`spack install python@3.6.4` results in an usable python3 installation.

### Actual Result

```
==> Executing phase: 'build'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 2:
    'make' '-j4'

1 error found in build log:
     895    		rm -f ./pybuilddir.txt ; \
     896    		exit 1 ; \
     897    	fi
     898    running build
     899    running build_ext
     900    error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/Users/healther/Documents/git.nosync/spack/opt/spack/darwin-highsierra-x86_64/clang-
            9.0.0-apple/python-3.6.4-j34o5jqkcypp3s7c2u5jqajutiopnjk3/include/python3.6m/pyconfig.h'
  >> 901    make: *** [sharedmods] Error 1
```

### Information on your system

current develop (-5 or so commits plus #4585 and #7204)
 ```
$ spack arch
darwin-highsierra-x86_64
```
nothing special installed (or at least visible to spack) so only the system `clang@9-apple`

I couldn't find any information only to it (@adamjstewart seems to have hit a similar problem when trying to build `boost+python@3:` but that's about it. If I read this correctly `spack` tries to access the to-be-populated prefix before actually installing stuff...

When I do
```
spack cd python@3.6.4 && spack build-env python@3.6.4 -- bash 
make
```
I see the same error, without the `build-env`, make runs through without a problem. I'm out of my depth here...

[spack-build.env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/1844527/spack-build.env.txt)
[spack-build.out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/1844528/spack-build.out.txt)
